channel.title: Jesper Andersen - Blog & DevLog
channel.description: Recent content on Jesper Andersen - Blog & DevLog

item.title: AI and how I use it
item.author: cph-ja472@stud.ek.dk (Jesper Andersen)
item.description:
Alrighty, let’s try to actually get a real “first” blog post going for this site.

What I use AI for
#

For today’s topic I wanted to address a bit about my personal use of AI, briefly what my opinion is on the doomsday talk about it taking our jobs, and how I use it day-to-day as a new programmer in a field where everything apparently is changing just as I get into it.

item.title: Maintenance Log - First Week
item.author: cph-ja472@stud.ek.dk (Jesper Andersen)
item.description:
So first of all welcome to this first week post of the development of my little maintenance log, just for posterity lets start with what is in my readme for the project, since that actually breaks down what it its:

#

Maintenance Log Backend
#

This project is a backend API for managing maintenance history of assets such as machines, vehicles, or equipment.

item.title: First Blog
item.author: cph-ja472@stud.ek.dk (Jesper Andersen)
item.description: First Blog, alot of testing going on with this template… nothing is set in stone for how it looks, but lets see where we end up when were done.

item.title: About me
item.author: cph-ja472@stud.ek.dk (Jesper Andersen)
item.description:
If you’ve somehow found your way here: welcome!

My name is Jesper Andersen. At the time of writing this (2026), I’m in my early thirties and currently working on my AP degree in Computer Science at EK – Lyngby in Denmark.

Before this, I spent 14 years in construction working as a journeyman painter.
